activities.loc: Branch 1 - Hearing by Zoom.  See enclosed information.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sara Phillips

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

[ma] Case called at 1:39 PM {This hearing is being conducted via Zoom videoconferencing.} 
Defendant Sara Phillips appeared by zoom .  Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa appears on behalf of Attorney Cassi Nelson appeared by zoom for Sara Phillips.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 

Atty De La Rosa indicates that settlement negotiations continue; requests an additional status be scheduled. 
--no objection from DA Hall

Ms. Phillips updates address to: 879 Bernon St., Apt 205, Woonsocket, RI 02985
recess: 1:45pm 
NEXT:  Status on 12/1/22 at 2:45pm via zoom

ADDRESS INFO for Sara Phillips
Current: 879 Bernon St, Apt. #205, Woonsocket, RI 02895 United States  (Effective: 09-08-2022)
Prior: 879 Bernon St, Apt. #216, Woonsocket, RI 02895 United States
JA review of 10/26/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/10/26/22)

Pre-trial conference on October 26, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Status conference on November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

[ml] Case called at 8:37AM
Defendant Sara Phillips appeared by video. Attorney Cassi Nelson appeared by video. DA Monica Hall appears for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video connection is sight and sound sufficient.
DA Hall verifies Victim Rights Compliance.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to all three counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

The Court states that all parties may appear via Zoom for the 11/01 Status date.

recess 8:41AM

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/26 at 9:40AM  (2) Status Conference on 11/01 at 1:30PM via Zoom
Arraignment on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK; Appearances of the Defendant and Defense counsel are by Zoom Conference] 
case called at 9:15am 
Defendant Sara Phillips appears by video.. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears by video. DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance. 
Officer I. Keats- sworn & testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall
--cross examination by Attorney Nelson
The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Phillips committed a felony. The Court binds her over for trial.

During scheduling discussions, Mr. Phillips indicates that she is moving to Rhode Island tomorrow.  She indicates her new address is:  879 Bernon Street, Apt. #216, Woonsocket RI 62895 [clerk corrects zip code to be 02895 per internet search]  
recess 9:25am

NEXT:  Arraignment on September 27th at 8:30am--appearances of the Defendant and Defense counsel by Zoom

Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (08/09) ML
Preliminary hearing on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[MK] case called at 10:56am
Defendant Sara Phllips in court with Attorney Cassi Nelson. ADA Theresa Beck, appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance.  
Attorney Nelson request the scheduling of a preliminary hearing; time limits are waived. 
recess 10:59am, reconvene 11:06am
Attorney Nelson provides information regarding Ms. Phillips need to travel to provide caregiving for a family member; the Defense requests that the next hearing be held with Zoom appearances.
The Court grants the request.
recess 11:08am

NEXT:  Preliminary Hearing with appearances by Zoom on September 8th at 9:00am

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Att Nelson
Status conference on July 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[MK] case called at 10:40am  
Defendant Sara Phillips in court.  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.
The clerk reports that she learned from Jefferson Public Defenders Office staff this morning that Ms. Phillips applied for representation and she has been found eligible. The PD Office is making efforts to appoint counsel for her.  
In response to the clerk's inquiry, Ms. Phillips provides a new address in Loves Park, IL. 
recess 10:43am 

NEXT: (1) the PD will be filing a notice verifying PD eligibility,  (2) Status Conference on July 22nd at 10:30am  [JA-note in comments that this case is at prelim stage]

ADDRESS INFO for Sara Phillips
Current: PO Box 2801, Loves Park, IL 61132 United States  (Effective: 06-24-2022)
Prior: 855 E. Lake St. #44, Lake Mills, WI 53551
Status conference on June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 8:52am 
Defendant Sara Phillips in court.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court reviews right to counsel.  Ms. Phillips indicates that she has not taken steps to seek counsel. She is currently unemployed. 
The Court requires Ms. Phillips to telephone the Jfferson Public Defenders Office (telephone number is provided) today to apply for PD representation. Further she is to go to the Clerk of Courts Office after the hearing to file a petition for the appointment of counsel so that the clerk has the petition-form to process if it is learned that Ms. Phillips does not qualify for PD representation. 
recess 8:55am.

NEXT:  Status Conference (status of counsel; JA-note in comments that case is at prelim stage) on June 24th at 10:30am
Scheduling Order
Status conference on May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Case called at 1:29PM
Defendant Sara Phillips appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def declined eval).  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Parson verifies Victim Right's Compliance.
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will toll time 

The Court requires a $750.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim (Defendant shall communicate with the Defendant via a third party with respect to any transfer of property or property issues) 
--no acts or threats of violence
--the Defendant shall leave the keys with the Watertown Police Department for the Victim to retrieve 

recess 1:37PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/23 at 8:30AM with in person appearances
